## ðŸŽ¯ Best Practices for Claude Max

### 1. Set Up Projects Properly

**For books-flutter:**

```
Project Name: BooksTrack Flutter
Description: Cross-platform book tracking app with AI scanner

Custom Instructions:
- Follow CLAUDE.md strictly
- Use Riverpod with code generation
- Follow Material Design 3
- Use Drift for local database
- Cloudflare Workers for backend
- Reference Flutter PRDs in product/ directory

Knowledge Files:
- CLAUDE.md
- TODO_REFINED.md
- All PRDs in product/
- GITHUB_ZEN_SETUP.md
- AI_COLLABORATION.md
```

**Benefits:**
- Never repeat project context
- Consistent code quality
- Faster responses
- Better pattern matching

### 2. Use Local Haiku Aggressively

**Default to Haiku for:**
- File operations
- Simple refactoring
- Formatting
- Quick questions
- Search/replace operations

**Claude Max makes this FREE:**

```bash
# In Claude Code
"Rename all instances of 'Book' to 'WorkDTO' in lib/core/models/"
# Uses local Haiku â†’ FREE

"Format all files in lib/features/scanner/"
# Uses local Haiku â†’ FREE

"Add JSDoc comments to all public methods in this file"
# Uses local Haiku â†’ FREE
```

**Escalate to premium models only when needed:**
- Security audits
- Architecture decisions
- Complex debugging

### 3. Leverage Extended Context

**Take advantage of 200K context:**

```bash
# Analyze entire feature at once
"Review the entire scanner feature for consistency:
lib/features/scanner/ (all files)
lib/core/services/scanner_api.dart
lib/shared/widgets/scanner_*.dart
test/features/scanner/ (all tests)

Check for:
- Pattern consistency
- Error handling
- Performance issues
- Test coverage"

# Claude Max can analyze all ~80 files at once
```

**Without Max:** Would need to break into chunks

### 4. Combine with Zen MCP Wisely

**Workflow:**

```bash
# Step 1: Use Claude Max (FREE local Haiku)
"Quick refactoring of scanner providers to match new patterns"
# FREE with local Haiku

# Step 2: For deep analysis, use Zen MCP
/code-review files=lib/features/scanner/ review_type=security
# Uses Gemini 2.5 Pro (~$0.50)

# Step 3: Architecture validation with Zen MCP
/analyze files=lib/features/scanner/ type=architecture
# Uses O3 Pro (~$1-2)
```

**Cost:** $1.50-2.50 instead of $10-20 without optimization

## ðŸ’¡ Power User Tips

### 1. Create Project per Repository

```
Claude Max Projects:
- books-flutter â†’ Flutter patterns
```

### 2. Use Projects for Knowledge Base

**Instead of re-explaining every time:**


### 3. Maximize Local Haiku Usage

**Track your savings:**


### 4. Combine All Tools Optimally

**Morning (9 AM):**
```
# Assign to Jules (Gemini Pro)
jules.google.com: "Implement reading statistics feature"
# 1 task used (60/day available)
```

**During Day:**
```
# Work with Copilot Pro+ (IDE)
Real-time autocomplete (unlimited, free)
Quick questions (uses premium requests, have 1,500/month)
```

**Afternoon (3 PM):**
```
# Jules PR ready
# Review with Claude Max (Projects context)
"Review Jules' PR for CLAUDE.md compliance"
# Uses local Haiku (FREE) or Opus 4 (included)
```

**Evening (5 PM):**
```
# Deep validation with Zen MCP
/code-review review_type=security
# Uses Gemini 2.5 Pro ($0.50)
# Only when needed, most work done by free tools
```

**Cost for entire feature:**
- Jules: Included with Gemini Pro
- Copilot: ~5-10 premium requests (~$0.20-0.40)
- Claude Max: $0 (included in subscription)
- Zen MCP: $0.50 (security audit only)

**Total AI cost per feature:** ~$0.70-0.90
